etymologies: mid 17th century: from modern Latin fritillaria, from Latin fritillus ‘dice box’ (probably with reference to the checkered corolla of the snake's head fritillary)

definitions: a Eurasian plant of the lily family, with hanging bell-like flowers.

notes.text: Genus Fritillaria, family Liliaceae: numerous species

definitions: a butterfly with orange-brown wings that are checkered with black.

notes.text: Subfamilies Argynninae and Melitaeinae, family Nymphalidae: Argynnis, Speyeria, and other genera, and numerous species, including the North American great spangled fritillary (S. cybele)

shortDefinitions: butterfly with orange-brown wings that are chequered with black
